fields.description:
The Student Association is the University of Tulsa student government body. It is organized into three branches: the Executive Branch, which includes Cabinet and is in charge of organizing large campus wide events and activities; the Judicial Branch; and the Legislative Branch, or Student Senate, which coordinates funding, oversees student organizations, and addresses general issues impacting student life on campus. Its budget is provided partially by the university and partially by a fee paid by students each semester.

Traditionally, the Student Association coordinates Homecoming activities, including cross campus competitions and the homecoming game tailgate. Another traditional event is Springfest, a week long series of events including food, various on campus activities, and a concert bringing in such names as Cake, Guster, and Ben Folds. Activities organized by Student Association are free to all TU students.

fields.summary: COMMUNITY SERVICE / PART-TIME JOBS / INTERNSHIP JOB FAIR
Mandatory Allocations Information Sessions (Chouteau Room in ACAC): rd

fields.description:
Did you know that you are one of over 130 TU students who are volunteering as a Big Brother or Big Sister this year? And in the last two weeks, we've had 150 more sign up! At this rate, we'll easily be able to match every kid who wants a Big Brother or Big Sister! 
 
To get the school year off to a great start, come to our Kick-Off Party next Wednesday, Sept 4th, from 6-8pm at the Student Activity Center (SAC) in the Mayo Apt Village. As a current Big, your name is already entered to win a QT gift card. In addition, for every person you bring to the kick-off event, your name will be entered again, and everyone who fills out an application gets their name in another drawing for a QT gift card. At the bottom of this e-mail you can click to forward this invite onto your friends! The more people you invite, the better your chances to win a $25 QT Gift Card! Must be present to win! We will have free pizza and pop and door prizes. 
 
Plus, you'll get a chance to meet other Bigs who visit at your Little's Elementary school. Give us input about what you want Big Brothers Big Sisters to do this school year and help make it happen.
 
If you have questions, just shoot an e-mail back at me. 
 Christina Jacob
Big Brothers Big Sisters of Oklahoma Intern and TU student

Paper applications can be turned into: Holmes Student Center, Room 25
 or faxed to (918) 744-4472  
Questions? 
 Call 918-744-4400
fields.summary: Big Brothers Big Sisters Kick Off

The office of Career Services would like to invite you to the Engineering and Technology Job Fair on September 10, 2008 from 10-2 in Keplinger Hall.  TU will be hosting a variety of organizations and companies who are seeking to fill an assortment of positions with TU engineering students.  Among those attending are organizations such as:

Bullet,
American Electric & Power,
Baker Hughes,
Chesapeake Energy Corporation,
EngATech,
Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company,
Magellan Midstream Partners, L.P.,
NORDAM,
ONEOK, Inc.,
Questar Exploration & Production,
RAE Corporation,
SemGroup,
Sunoco, Inc.,
U.S. Army Recruiting Company, Tulsa,
U.S. Central Intelligence Agency,
ABF Freight System, Inc.,
C P Kelco,
Caterpillar, Inc.,
Cessna Aircraft Company,
Cimarex,
Coffeyville Resources,
ConocoPhillips,
Continental Resources, Inc.,
Cudd Energy Services,
Data-Tronics Corporation,
Deloitte Consulting, LLP,
Devon Energy Corporation,
Dresser-Rand Company,
Enogex,
Exterran,
Federal Bureau of Investigation,
Georgia-Pacific, LLC,
Gerdau AmeriSteel,
Helicomb International,
Helmerich & Payne, Inc.,
Information Technology Center - U. S. Postal Service, John Zink Company L.L.C., Koch Industries, Minerals Management Service, NATCO GROUP INC, National Security Agency, NORDAM, OGE Energy Corp., Oklahoma Department of Environmental Quality, Range Resources, Inc., Samson, Sandridge Energy, Inc., Schlumberger Technology Corp., Spirit AeroSystems, Tinker Air Force Base, Unit Petroleum Company, United States Marine Corps, Willbros Engineers (U.S.), LLC, Williams, Wood Group – ESP, Yuba Heat Transfer, Zeeco, Inc., 

The job fair is an opportunity to familiarize you with over 50 companies.  The representatives who are attending are interested in giving you more information about their companies and discussing potential job openings as well as internship possibilities. Come by the Keplinger Hall between 10:00 a.m. and 2:00 a.m.  dressed nicely and with plenty of resumes.

We hope to see you there,

Tim Butterworth
Career Specialist-College of Engineering and Natural Sciences Career Services

This Week's Event is:

Field Day/Remembrance Day
Intramural Field/rain location is inside Collins Fitness Center
6 pm - 9 pm
Thursday, September 11

Remember the good ol days back in elementary school when you got to go to field day? That's what this is all about!

Games include:
3-Legged Race
Water Balloon Toss
Wheel Barrow Race
Potato Sack Race
Egg Toss
Crab Crawl Race
Tricycle Race
Crazy Bat Race
Balloon Shaving
Jello Eating Contest
Random Clothing Relay
Bucket and Spoon Water Race

Teams of two will compete in each event. Points will be awarded to those who compete in each event and higher points to those who win each event. The teams with the highest scores at the end of the night will receive prizes of the following:

1st Place - $100 per team member and a kiddie bike
2nd Place - $50 per team member and a hula-hoop
3rd Place - $25 per team member and a hula-hoop

Games start at 6 pm on the Intramural Field. If it is raining, we will be having it inside of Collins Fitness Center. Regardless of the weather, anything that will make a mess will be outside. :) Registration will open at 6:00 pm. All teams must be registered by 6:30 pm. Just email Gennie at g@utulsa.edu to pre-register or show up on Thursday.

As part of the remembrance of September 11, feel free to make stationary or write a letter to our troops for Operation Stars and Stripes. All supplies provided.

-- 

For the most up to date information on what's happening with Residence live visit http://www.utulsa.edu/housing/life/calendar.html


Gennie Lynn
SWACURH Regional Advisor
Area Coordinator
The University of Tulsa
2821 E. 8th Street
Tulsa, OK 74104
918-631-2343 - office
918-845-0804 - cell
www.utulsa.edu/housing

fields.description:
Show TU who is the best in a Battle of the Bands on the U on Thursday, September the 18th. Bands should be
able to play a 30 minute set with no more than 1 cover. At least one member of your band must be a TU student or Alumni to win prizes. Your band will be contacted one week prior to the battle to let you know if you will be
performing and your scheduled time. To enter, please e-mail bob08@utulsa.edu by September 10th at 5:00 pm with a link to your music if posted online, or arrange a drop-off of a demo CD. Please also provide contact info for the band, and a list of members as well as any equipment needs.
Log on to WebCT or use the link above to vote for your 2008 Homecoming King and Queen.

Students, Faculty and Staff members from TU will assist in a very important neighborhood project on Saturday, September 20^th .  We will be painting/stenciling house numbers on curbs in the neighborhood north of TU.  This is part of a city-wide effort to assist emergency personnel as they respond to distress calls.

 
Date:  Saturday, September 20^th

Time:  8:30 am – noon

 
A meeting location will be designated prior to project date.  Painting supplies will be provided.

 
For more information or to sign up as a volunteer please contact Mike Mills at 631-2510 or Michael-mills@utulsa.edu.

The Student Association is the University of Tulsa student government body. It is organized into three branches: the Executive Branch, which includes Cabinet and is in charge of organizing large campus wide events and activities; the Judicial Branch; and the Legislative Branch, or Student Senate, which coordinates funding, oversees student organizations, and addresses general issues impacting student life on campus. Cross Canadian Ragweed will be performing a concert free for students as a part of the University of Tulsa's weeklong Homecoming events.  Tickets for all non-students at $15 and available at the Reynolds Center box office.

TU’s School of Art 
presents 
a lecture by the artist Mel Chin 
as part of 
the J. Donald Feagin Distinguished Guest Lecture Series 
Thursday, October 2, 7:00 pm 
University of Tulsa, Chapman Lecture Hall 
  
Mel Chin will hold a workshop for students and all interested the following day, 
Friday, October 3, 11:00 am to 1:00 pm, University of Tulsa, Alexandre Hogue Gallery 
  
Mel Chin’s work defies easy classification, it ranges from land reclamation projects, public art installations, film, video games, to gallery objects and appears in unlikely places such as industrial waste land, destroyed homes, even popular television programs. What all these projects share is the artist’s concern with ecology and his desire to provoke greater social and environmental awareness and responsibility through his work. His most recent project, Paydirt, is a response to lead contamination in post-Katrina New Orleans. 
Mel Chin has received numerous awards and honors, including awards from the National Endowment for the Arts, and an honorary doctorate from Rhode Island School of Design.
For more information about these events call TU’s School of Art at 918-631-2739.
 (Chapman Lecture Hall is located in Chapman Hall on E. 5th Street – from 11th Street turn North onto S. Delaware, go two blocks and turn East onto E. 5th Street, packing is available across the street from Chapman Hall)
fields.summary: Lecture Series by Mel Chin using images about environmental issues
fields.location: University of Tulsa, Chapman Lecture Hall

fields.description: Penny wars is a Mortarboard event to raise money for our national cause "reading is leading". To support this initiative we will be donating any money we raise to Reading Is Fundamental (RIF). Penny wars will be a competition between the "colleges" on campus. There will be cans for each college set up in the Caf, ACAC and hopefully in each college's advising office. You want to get as many pennies as possible in your can and put as many silver coins as possible in everyone else's can. The pennies are worth $0.01 and the silver are worth negative face value. It will take place next week between October 20-24.
fields.location: ACAC, the "Caf", and potentially each college's advising office

Student Association's annual AirBand lip sync competition is Sunday, November 2nd at 9:00 p.m. Sign your group up and you could win cash prizes!

AirBand coincides with Tulsa Time, so you get to show off your organization's fun side to incoming freshmen while trying to earn these cash prizes:

1st Place -- $300
2nd Place -- $200
3rd Place -- $100

*Name of Organization*

Interested in attending one of TU‚s graduate programs? 
Want some more info on our application and admissions process?
Don‚t delay, mark your calendar now:

>>GRADUATE SCHOOL OPEN HOUSE
***Thursday, November 6, 2008
***5:30 ˆ 7:30 PM
**Heritage Room, Collins Hall

Presentations by the TU Graduate School and Student Financial Services will address the application process and ways to finance your graduate education.  There will be an opportunity for questions and answers following the presentation.   You will also have the opportunity to discuss your academic goals with program faculty members and to speak with students currently enrolled in the program about their own experiences at TU.

> Refreshments will be available throughout the event.

> In order to make arrangements for the appropriate program representatives, we will need to know if you will be attending.
 
> If you plan on attending, please* RSVP by Monday, November 3. *

> For more information and to reserve a seat, visit 
> http://www.utulsa.edu/graduate/Open_House_Info.htm

> We look forward to seeing you there!

Sincerely,
Hope Geiger
Senior Graduate School Admissions & Student Services Coordinator
University of Tulsa

The Student Association's annual Officer's Club is an opportunity for the officers of student organizations to meet, mingle, and learn about some amazing opportunities.  SA provides a nice dinner, chances to win prizes, information and presentations on how SA can better serve your organization, and a chance to get to know other leaders around campus.

This evening is in high demand so there is a limit of two officers per organization.  Please RSVP to sa@utulsa.edu by Friday Nov. 7th.

fields.description:
We need lots of volunteers this weekend to lay the floor and finish the house. This is the last build day of the semester, so don't miss your chance to help out!!

We have carpools leaving ACAC at 8am and at 10am.  

Hey Habitat-ers!

  This Saturday is your LAST CHANCE to volunteer at Habitat this semester.  We really need lots of people to come out and lay the floor to finish the house.  So tell all your friends, and lets make a great representation of TU, by bringing a big group out!

You can join the carpool at 8am or 10am - or you can drive yourself:

 Go North on Harvard Ave, -2.6mi.
 Turn left at E Apache St - 0.6 mi
 Turn right at N Columbia Ave - 0.2 mi
 Follow the street around the curve until you see parking in the lot behind the house.

Arrive at: 2727 East 28th St N Tulsa, OK 74110

Thanks y'all!

  Denise Posluszny
  Habitat for Humanity, Treasurer
  denise-posluszny@utulsa.edu
  918-645-7507

fields.location: ACAC - Second Floor - See SA website for specific room

fields.description: Weekly meeting of the Government Operations Committee for the Senate of the Student Association of the University of Tulsa.

The Student Association is the University of Tulsa student government body. It is organized into three branches: the Executive Branch, which includes Cabinet and is in charge of organizing large campus wide events and activities; the Judicial Branch; and the Legislative Branch, or Student Senate, which coordinates funding, oversees student organizations, and addresses general issues impacting student life on campus. Its budget is provided partially by the university and partially by a fee paid by students each semester.

Traditionally, the Student Association coordinates Homecoming activities, including cross campus competitions and the homecoming game tailgate. Another traditional event is Springfest, a week long series of events including food, various on campus activities, and a concert bringing in such names as Cake, Guster, and Ben Folds. Activities organized by Student Association are free to all TU students.

You're never too old for Santa!

We hope you've been good little boys and girls this year, because SA is bringing jolly old St. Nick to TU so students can give him their Christmas wishes! Students will leave with a Polaroid picture to cherish the memory. Take advantage of this opportunity and bring all your friends; a picture with Santa would make a great Christmas gift for parents!

http://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=36759537908

Come Celebrate the C-USA Championship Game with the first ever Golden Hurricane Polar Bear Run.  THIS IS YOUR CHANCE TO GET ON TV FOR THE BIG GAME

TU Students are invited come out to Tucker Drive at 9:15 for TU’s first Polar Bear Run.  Strip down and paint up to show your Golden Hurricane Spirit! 

The race begins on the east side of Tucker Drive at 9:30 AM sharp.  Race fellow students around to Bayless Plaza and end by running through Genave King Rogers Fountain for the big finish!

After the race, you can warm up with free food and hot chocolate in the HEATED Polar Bear Den!

1st Prize for the individual that embraces both the Golden Hurricane and Polar Bear Spirit will win a free student travel package from Tulsa to the TU Bowl Game compliments of the TU Alumni Association

1st Prize for the student organization with most spirited participation will receive a private party at Full Moon Café for their student organization

ALL STUDENTS THAT PARTICIPATE RECEIVE A FREE LONG SLEEVED POLAR BEAR RUN SHIRT


Rules:

- Individuals and Groups must register before the race at the race the check-in

- All participants must wear shoes

- NO NUDITY

- Prizes are awarded on SPIRIT and FLAIR not speed

Questions? Contact Calvin Moniz (calvin-moniz@utulsa.edu)


http://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=56682931128

fields.summary: Community Service Event (BBBS Christmas 4 Kids) - Delta Sigma Theta

fields.description:
Benefiting St. Jude Children's Research Hospital

The Theta Upsilon chapter of Delta Delta Delta would like to invite you all to our Third Annual Pancake Breakfast benefiting St. Jude Children's Research Hospital. Pancakes will be served all night for a $5 donation. One-hundred percent of the funds raised will be sent to St. Jude. For more information on the hospital, please visit www.stjude.org. We look forward to seeing you all there!

http://www.facebook.com/event.php?eid=40346155495
fields.summary: Delta Delta Delta's Third Annual Pancake Breakfast
fields.location: The Tri Delta House at the University of Tulsa, 3112 E. 5th Place

fields.description:
Light Up TU!

Participate in SA's annual Christmas lights competition to help light up TU and spread the season's cheer!  Prizes are $500 for 1st place, $250 for 2nd place, $100 for 3rd place.  Judging will occur at sundown on Saturday, December 13.

Organizations without a space to decorate can contact building administrators to request space.

Organizations should notify Student Association of participation in the competition by emailing sa@utulsa.edu with their organization name and the location of their display. Deadline to enter is Wednesday, December 10 @ 5:00 p.m.

fields.description: This is a half day conference focusing on leadership skills.  Speakers include faculty, alumni, and local community leaders.  To attend, sign up in the Office of Student Affairs or email laura-allen@utulsa.edu.
Open to all TU students - sponsored by the Chinese Student Association.  For more information contact chenliang-fan@utulsa.edu.

"Chinese Spring Festival is the Chinese Student Association’s biggest and oldest events we have hosted and we’re excited to celebrate it again this year. We are glad to have many student talents in the University of Tulsa. We will invite students, presenters, dancers and other performers who have practiced the Chinese arts and entertainment and give everyone in the Tulsa Community a great show. Chinese food will be provided. We welcome everyone to attend and to know more of the Chinese culture...All officers are definitely excited and ready to plan this event and its going to be one of the biggest events in the campus."

fields.description: Come hear Clifton Taulbert, author of "Eight Habits of the Heart" speak on Brotherhood and Courage.  Lunch is provided.  Hosted by Laura McNeese, New Student Programs and Services.

Jeremy Kuzmarov - Job Candidate in History, PhD Brandeis University, Visiting Lecturer in History at Bucknell University - presents his lecture: "Modernizing Repression?: Police Training and Nation-Building in the American Century".

It's sure to be a fascinating event that you won't want to miss!
